org.jsimpledb.core

Class Transaction

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.jsimpledb.core.Transaction

  • public class Transaction
extends Object
    A JSimpleDB Database transaction.

    Methods in this class can be divided into the following categories:

    Transaction Meta-Data

    • getDatabase() - Get the associated Database
    • getSchema() - Get the database Schema, as seen by this transaction
    • getSchemaVersion() - Get the SchemaVersion that will be used by this transaction

    Transaction Lifecycle

    • commit() - Commit transaction
    • rollback() - Roll back transaction
    • isValid() - Test transaction validity
    • setTimeout() - Set transaction timeout
    • setReadOnly() - Set transaction to read-only
    • setRollbackOnly() - Set transaction for rollack only
    • addCallback() - Register a Transaction.Callback on transaction completion

    Object Lifecycle

    • create() - Create a database object
    • delete() - Delete a database object
    • exists() - Test whether a database object exists
    • addCreateListener() - Register a CreateListener for notifications about new objects
    • removeCreateListener() - Unregister a CreateListener
    • addDeleteListener() - Register a DeleteListener for notifications about object deletions
    • removeDeleteListener() - Unregister a DeleteListener

    Object Versioning

    • getSchemaVersion() - Inspect an object's schema version
    • updateSchemaVersion() - Update an object's schema version to match this transaction
    • addVersionChangeListener() - Register a VersionChangeListener for notifications about object version changes
    • removeVersionChangeListener() - Unregister a VersionChangeListener

    Object and Field Access

    • getAll() - Get all objects of a specific type
    • readSimpleField() - Read the value of a SimpleField in an object
    • writeSimpleField() - Write the value of a SimpleField in an object
    • readSetField() - Access a SetField in an object as a NavigableSet
    • readListField() - Access a ListField in an object as a List
    • readMapField() - Access a MapField in an object as a NavigableMap
    • getKey(ObjId) - Get the KVDatabase key corresponding to an object
    • getKey(ObjId, int) - Get the KVDatabase key corresponding to a field in an object

    Field Change Notifications

    • addSimpleFieldChangeListener() - Register a SimpleFieldChangeListener for notifications of changes in a SimpleField, as seen through a path of object references
    • addSetFieldChangeListener() - Register a SetFieldChangeListener for notifications of changes in a SetField, as seen through a path of object references
    • addListFieldChangeListener() - Register a ListFieldChangeListener for notifications of changes in a ListField, as seen through a path of object references
    • addMapFieldChangeListener() - Register a MapFieldChangeListener for notifications of changes in a MapField, as seen through a path of object references
    • removeSimpleFieldChangeListener() - Unregister a previously registered SimpleFieldChangeListener
    • removeSetFieldChangeListener() - Unregister a previously registered SetFieldChangeListener
    • removeListFieldChangeListener() - Unregister a previously registered ListFieldChangeListener
    • removeMapFieldChangeListener() - Unregister a previously registered MapFieldChangeListener

    Reference Path Queries

    • invertReferencePath() - Find all objects that refer to any element in a given set of objects through a specified reference path

    Index Queries

    • querySimpleField() - Query the index associated with a SimpleField to identify all values and all objects having those values
    • querySetField() - Query the index associated with a SetField to identify all set elements and all objects having those elements in the set
    • queryListField() - Query the index associated with a ListField to identify all list elements and all objects having those elements in the list
    • queryListFieldEntries() - Query the index associated with a ListField to identify all list elements and all objects with those elements in the list, as well as the associated list indicies
    • queryMapFieldKey() - Query the index associated with a MapField to identify all map keys and all objects having those keys in the map
    • queryMapFieldKeyEntries() - Query the index associated with a MapField to identify all map keys and all objects having those keys in the map, as well as the associated map values
    • queryMapFieldValue() - Query the index associated with a MapField to identify all map values and all objects having those values in the map
    • queryMapFieldValueEntries() - Query the index associated with a MapField to identify all map values and all objects having those values in the map, as well as the associated map keys

    All methods returning a set of values return a NavigableSet. The NavigableSets utility class provides methods for the efficient intersection, union, difference, and symmetric difference of NavigableSets containing the same element type, thereby providing the equivalent of traditional database joins.

      Callback interface for notification of transaction completion events.

        protected final Logger log

    • Method Detail

      • getDatabase

        public Database getDatabase()
        Get the database with which this transaction is associated.

      • getSchema

        public Schema getSchema()
        Get the database schema versions known to this transaction. This reflects all schema versions currently recorded in the database.

      • getSchemaVersion

        public SchemaVersion getSchemaVersion()
        Get the database schema version associated with this transaction. This is the target version when updating objects' schema versions. Reads of fields (optionally) and writes to fields (always) result in updating the schema version of the object.

      • getKVTransaction

        public KVTransaction getKVTransaction()
        Get the underlying key/value store transaction.

        Warning: making changes to the key/value store directly is not supported. If any changes are made, all future behavior is undefined.

      • commit

        public void commit()
        Commit this transaction.
        Throws:
        StaleTransactionException - if this transaction is no longer usable
        RetryTransactionException - from KVTransaction.commit()
        RollbackOnlyTransactionException - if this instance has been marked rollback only; this instance will be automatically rolled back

      • rollback

        public void rollback()
        Roll back this transaction.
        Throws:
        StaleTransactionException - if this transaction is no longer usable

      • isValid

        public boolean isValid()
        Determine whether this transaction is still valid. If not, all other methods in this class will throw StaleTransactionException.

      • isReadOnly

        public boolean isReadOnly()
        Determine whether this transaction is read-only.
        Throws:
        StaleTransactionException - if this transaction is no longer usable

      • setReadOnly

        public void setReadOnly(boolean readOnly)
        Enable or disaable read-only mode. When in read-only mode, all mutating operations will fail with a ReadOnlyTransactionException.
        Throws:
        StaleTransactionException - if this transaction is no longer usable

      • isRollbackOnly

        public boolean isRollbackOnly()
        Determine whether this transaction is marked rollback only.
        Throws:
        StaleTransactionException - if this transaction is no longer usable

      • setRollbackOnly

        public void setRollbackOnly()
        Mark this transaction for rollback only. A subsequent attempt to commit() will throw an exception.
        Throws:
        StaleTransactionException - if this transaction is no longer usable

      • setTimeout

        public void setTimeout(long timeout)
        Change the timeout for this transaction from its default value (optional operation).
        Parameters:
        timeout - transaction timeout in milliseconds, or zero for unlimited
        Throws:
        UnsupportedOperationException - if this transaction does not support timeouts
        IllegalArgumentException - if timeout is negative
        StaleTransactionException - if this transaction is no longer usable

      • addCallback

        public void addCallback(Transaction.Callback callback)
        Register a transaction Transaction.Callback to be invoked when this transaction completes. Callbacks will be invoked in the order they are registered.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if callback is null
        StaleTransactionException - if this transaction is no longer usable

      • create

        public boolean create(ObjId id)
        Create a new object with the given object ID, if it doesn't already exist. If it does exist, nothing happens.

        If the object doesn't already exist, all fields are set to their default values and the object's schema version is set to the version associated with this transaction.

        Parameters:
        id - object ID
        Returns:
        true if the object did not exist and was created, false if the object already existed
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if the storage ID associated with id does not correspond to a known object type in this transaction's schema
        IllegalArgumentException - if id is null
        ReadOnlyTransactionException - if this transaction has been set read-only
        StaleTransactionException - if this transaction is no longer usable

      • create

        public ObjId create(int storageId)
        Create a new object with a randomly assigned object ID and having the given type.

        All fields will be set to their default values. The object's schema version will be set to the version associated with this transaction.

        Parameters:
        storageId - object type storage ID
        Returns:
        object id of newly created object
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if storageId does not correspond to a known object type in this transaction's schema
        ReadOnlyTransactionException - if this transaction has been set read-only
        StaleTransactionException - if this transaction is no longer usable

      • delete

        public boolean delete(ObjId id)
        Delete an object. Does nothing if object does not exist (e.g., has already been deleted).

        This method does not change the object's schema version if it has a different version that this transaction.

        Parameters:
        id - object ID of the object to delete
        Returns:
        true if object was found and deleted, false if object was not found
        Throws:
        ReferencedObjectException - if the object is referenced by some other object through a reference field set to DeleteAction.EXCEPTION
        IllegalArgumentException - if id is null
        ReadOnlyTransactionException - if this transaction has been set read-only
        StaleTransactionException - if this transaction is no longer usable

      • exists

        public boolean exists(ObjId id)
        Determine if an object exists.

        This method does not change the object's schema version if it exists and has a different version that this transaction.

        Parameters:
        id - object ID of the object to find
        Returns:
        true if object was found, false if object was not found
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if id is null

      • getSchemaVersion

        public int getSchemaVersion(ObjId id)
        Read the current schema version of the given object. Does not change the object's version.
        Parameters:
        id - object id
        Returns:
        object's current schema version
        Throws:
        StaleTransactionException - if this transaction is no longer usable
        DeletedObjectException - if no object with ID equal to id is found
        IllegalArgumentException - if id is null

      • updateSchemaVersion

        public boolean updateSchemaVersion(ObjId id)
        Change the schema version of the specified object, if necessary, so that its version matches the schema version associated with this transaction.

        If a schema change occurs, any registered VersionChangeListeners will be notified prior to this method returning.

        Parameters:
        id - object ID of the object to delete
        Returns:
        true if the object schema version was changed, otherwise false
        Throws:
        StaleTransactionException - if this transaction is no longer usable
        ReadOnlyTransactionException - if this transaction has been set read-only
        DeletedObjectException - if no object with ID equal to id is found
        IllegalArgumentException - if id is null
        See Also:
        getSchemaVersion()

        public void addVersionChangeListener(VersionChangeListener listener)
        Add an VersionChangeListener to this transaction.
        Parameters:
        listener - the listener to add
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if listener is null
        StaleTransactionException - if this transaction is no longer usable

        Parameters:

        Throws:
        StaleTransactionException - if this transaction is no longer usable
        IllegalArgumentException - if listener is null

      • getAll

        public NavigableSet<ObjId> getAll(int storageId)
        Get all objects whose object type has the specified storage ID.

        The returned set is mutable, with the exception that add() is not supported. Deleting an element results in deleting the corresponding object.

        Parameters:
        storageId - object type storage ID
        Returns:
        set containing all objects having the specified storage ID
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if storageId does not correspond to any known object type
        StaleTransactionException - if this transaction is no longer usable

      • readSimpleField

        public Object readSimpleField(ObjId id,
                     int storageId)
        Read the value of a SimpleField from an object, automatically updating the object's schema version if necessary.

        Equivalent to:

        readSimpleField(id, storageId, true)

        Parameters:
        id - object ID of the object
        storageId - storage ID of the SimpleField
        Throws:
        StaleTransactionException - if this transaction is no longer usable
        DeletedObjectException - if no object with ID equal to id is found
        UnknownFieldException - if no field corresponding to storageId exists in the object
        IllegalArgumentException - if id is null

      • readSimpleField

        public Object readSimpleField(ObjId id,
                     int storageId,
                     boolean updateVersion)
        Read the value of a SimpleField from an object, optionally updating the object's schema version.

        If updateVersion is true, the schema version of the object will be automatically changed to match the schema version associated with this transaction, if necessary.

        Parameters:
        id - object ID of the object
        storageId - storage ID of the SimpleField
        updateVersion - true to automatically update the object's schema version, false to not change it
        Throws:
        StaleTransactionException - if this transaction is no longer usable
        DeletedObjectException - if no object with ID equal to id is found
        UnknownFieldException - if no field corresponding to storageId exists in the object
        IllegalArgumentException - if id is null

      • writeSimpleField

        public void writeSimpleField(ObjId id,
                    int storageId,
                    Object value)
        Change the value of a SimpleField in an object.

        The schema version of the object will be automatically changed to match the schema version associated with this transaction, if necessary.

        Parameters:
        id - object ID of the object
        storageId - storage ID of the SimpleField
        value - new value for the field
        Throws:
        StaleTransactionException - if this transaction is no longer usable
        DeletedObjectException - if no object with ID equal to id is found
        UnknownFieldException - if no field corresponding to storageId exists in the object
        IllegalArgumentException - if value is not an appropriate value for the field
        IllegalArgumentException - if id is null

      • getKey

        public byte[] getKey(ObjId id)
        Get the byte[] key in the underlying key/value store corresponding to the specified object.

        Notes:

        • This method does not check whether the object actually exists.
        • Objects utilize mutiple keys; the return value is the common prefix of all such keys.
        • The KVDatabase should not be modified directly, otherwise behavior is undefined

        Parameters:
        id - object ID
        Returns:
        the KVDatabase key corresponding to id
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if id is null

      • getKey

        public byte[] getKey(ObjId id,
            int storageId)
        Get the byte[] key in the underlying key/value store corresponding to the specified field in the specified object.

        Notes:

        • This method does not check whether the object exists or the field actually exists in the object.
        • Complex fields utilize mutiple keys; the return value is the common prefix of all such keys.
        • The KVDatabase should not be modified directly, otherwise behavior is undefined

        Parameters:
        id - object ID
        storageId - field storage ID
        Returns:
        the KVDatabase key of the field in the specified object
        Throws:
        UnknownFieldException - if no field corresponding to storageId exists
        IllegalArgumentException - if storageId corresponds to a sub-field of a complex field
        IllegalArgumentException - if storageId is less than or equal to zero
        IllegalArgumentException - if id is null

      • addSimpleFieldChangeListener

        public void addSimpleFieldChangeListener(int storageId,
                                int[] path,
                                SimpleFieldChangeListener listener)
        Monitor for changes within this transaction of the value of the given field, as seen through a path of references.

        When the specified field is changed, a listener notification will be delivered for each referring object that refers to the object containing the changed field through the specified path of references. Notifications are delivered at the end of the mutation operation just prior to returning to the caller. If the listener method performs additional mutation(s) which are themselves being listened for, those notifications will also be delivered prior to the returning to the original caller. Therefore, care must be taken to avoid change notification dependency loops when listeners can themselves mutate fields, to avoid infinite loops.

        A referring object may refer to the changed object through more than one actual path of references matching path; if so, it will still appear only once in the NavigableSet provided to the listener (this is of course required by set semantics).

        Although the reference back-tracking algorithm does consolidate multiple paths between the same two objects, be careful to avoid an explosion of notifications when objects in the path have a high degree of fan-in.

        When a ReferenceField in path also happens to be the field being changed, then there is ambiguity about how the set of referring objects is calculated: does it use the field's value before or after the change? This API guarantees that the answer is "after the change"; however, if another listener on the same field is invoked before listener and mutates any reference field(s) in path, then whether that additional change is also be included in the calculation is undefined.

        Therefore, for consistency, avoid changing any ReferenceField from within a listener callback when that field is also in some other listener's reference path, and both listeners are watching the same field.

        Parameters:
        storageId - storage ID of the field to monitor
        path - path of reference fields (represented by storage IDs) through which to monitor field
        listener - callback for notifications on changes in value
        Throws:
        UnknownFieldException - if no SimpleField corresponding to storageId exists
        UnknownFieldException - if path contains a storage ID that does not correspond to a ReferenceField
        IllegalArgumentException - if storageId refers to a sub-field of a complex field
        IllegalArgumentException - if path or listener is null
        StaleTransactionException - if this transaction is no longer usable

      • invertReferencePath

        public NavigableSet<ObjId> invertReferencePath(int[] path,
                                      Iterable<ObjId> targetObjects)
        Find all objects that refer to any object in the given target set through the specified path of references.
        Parameters:
        path - path of one or more reference fields (represented by storage IDs) through which to reach the target objects
        targetObjects - target objects
        Returns:
        set of objects that refer to the targetObjects via path
        Throws:
        UnknownFieldException - if path contains a storage ID that does not correspond to a ReferenceField
        IllegalArgumentException - if targetObjects or path is null
        IllegalArgumentException - if path is empty
        StaleTransactionException - if this transaction is no longer usable

      • querySimpleField

        public NavigableMap<?,NavigableSet<ObjId>> querySimpleField(int storageId)
        Find all values stored in the specified SimpleField and, for each value, the set of all objects having that value in the field.

        The storageId may refer to any SimpleField, whether part of an object or a sub-field of a ComplexField.

        Only objects having schema versions in which the field is indexed will be found; this method does not check whether any such schema versions exist.

        Parameters:
        storageId - SimpleField's storage ID
        Returns:
        read-only, real-time view of field values mapped to sets of objects with the value in the field
        Throws:
        UnknownFieldException - if no SimpleField corresponding to storageId exists
        StaleTransactionException - if this transaction is no longer usable

      • querySetField

        public NavigableMap<?,NavigableSet<ObjId>> querySetField(int storageId)
        Find all values stored as an element in the specified SetField and, for each such value, the set of all objects having that value as an element in the set.

        This method functions just like querySimpleField() but takes the storage ID of the SetField rather than its element SimpleField.

        Only objects having schema versions in which the set's element field is indexed will be found; this method does not check whether any such schema versions exist.

        Parameters:
        storageId - SetField's storage ID
        Returns:
        read-only, real-time view of set element values mapped to sets of objects with the value in the set
        Throws:
        UnknownFieldException - if no SetField corresponding to storageId exists
        StaleTransactionException - if this transaction is no longer usable

      • queryListField

        public NavigableMap<?,NavigableSet<ObjId>> queryListField(int storageId)

        This method functions just like querySimpleField() but takes the storage ID of the ListField rather than its element SimpleField.

        Only objects having schema versions in which the list's element field is indexed will be found; this method does not check whether any such schema versions exist.

        StaleTransactionException - if this transaction is no longer usable

      • queryMapFieldKey

        public NavigableMap<?,NavigableSet<ObjId>> queryMapFieldKey(int storageId)
        Find all values stored as a key in the specified MapField and, for each such key value, the set of all objects having that value as an key in the map.

        This method functions just like querySimpleField() but takes the storage ID of the MapField rather than its key SimpleField.

        Only objects having schema versions in which the map's key field is indexed will be found; this method does not check whether any such schema versions exist.

        Parameters:
        storageId - MapField's storage ID
        Returns:
        read-only, real-time view of map keys mapped to sets of objects with the value in the map as a key
        Throws:
        UnknownFieldException - if no MapField corresponding to storageId exists
        StaleTransactionException - if this transaction is no longer usable

        public NavigableMap<?,NavigableSet<ObjId>> queryMapFieldValue(int storageId)

        This method functions just like querySimpleField() but takes the storage ID of the MapField rather than its value SimpleField.

      • queryListFieldEntries

        public NavigableMap<?,NavigableSet<ListIndexEntry>> queryListFieldEntries(int storageId)
        Find all values stored as an element in the specified ListField and, for each such value, the set of all ListIndexEntry objects, each of which represents an object and a list index.

        Only objects having schema versions in which the list's element field is indexed will be found; this method does not check whether any such schema versions exist.

        Parameters:
        storageId - ListField's storage ID
        Returns:
        read-only, real-time view of list element values mapped to sets of ListIndexEntrys
        Throws:
        UnknownFieldException - if no ListField field corresponding to storageId exists
        StaleTransactionException - if this transaction is no longer usable

      • queryMapFieldKeyEntries

        public NavigableMap<?,NavigableSet<MapKeyIndexEntry<?>>> queryMapFieldKeyEntries(int storageId)
        Find all values stored as a key in the specified MapField and, for each such value, the set of all MapKeyIndexEntry objects, each of which represents an object and a corresponding map value.

        Only objects having schema versions in which the map's key field is indexed will be found; this method does not check whether any such schema versions exist.

        Parameters:
        storageId - MapField's storage ID
        Returns:
        read-only, real-time view of map key values mapped to sets of MapKeyIndexEntrys
        Throws:
        UnknownFieldException - if no MapField field corresponding to storageId exists
        StaleTransactionException - if this transaction is no longer usable

      • queryMapFieldValueEntries

        public NavigableMap<?,NavigableSet<MapValueIndexEntry<?>>> queryMapFieldValueEntries(int storageId)
        Find all values stored as a value in the specified MapField and, for each such value, a corresponding the set of all MapValueIndexEntry objects, each of which represents an object and a corresponding map key.

        Only objects having schema versions in which the map's value field is indexed will be found; this method does not check whether any such schema versions exist.

        Parameters:
        storageId - MapField's storage ID
        Returns:
        read-only, real-time view of all objects having the specified value in the map value field
        Throws:
        UnknownFieldException - if no MapField field corresponding to storageId exists
        IllegalArgumentException - if value is not a valid value for the map's value field
        StaleTransactionException - if this transaction is no longer usable
